Hi Cantera users

I have a bit of a problem which puzzles me. With cantera =
(1.6r3 on
windows and Linux) with python 2.4 when I create a gas object at
=
standard conditions e.g. 

>>> import Cantera
>>> gas =3D Cantera.importPha=
se('Air.cti')
>>> print gas 

       temperature             300  K
       =
   pressure          101325  Pa
           density         1.17681  kg/m^3
=
  mean mol. weight         28.9697  amu

                          1 kg    =
        1 kmol
                       -----------      ------------
       =
   enthalpy         1893.98        5.487e+04     J
   internal energy      =
  -84207.6       -2.439e+06     J
           entropy         6866.03       =
 1.989e+05     J/K
    Gibbs function    -2.05792e+06       -5.962e+07     =
J
 heat capacity c_p         1003.06        2.906e+04     J/K
 heat capacit=
y c_v          716.05        2.074e+04     J/K

                          X=
                 Y          Chem. Pot. / RT
                     ----------=
---     ------------     ------------
                 O              0    =
            0
                O2           0.21         0.231957         -2=
6.2344
                 N              0                0
                N=
O              0                0
               NO2              0        =
        0
               N2O              0                0
              =
  N2           0.78         0.754253         -23.2816
                AR   =
        0.01        0.0137896         -23.2152


I get a negative internal =
energy. How come? I didn't think internal
energy could be negative, or have=
 I missed something obvious here
(like 1. grade thermodynamics)?

Any help =
is appreciated

Anders
